publicwhip.spmotion: *S3M-3494 Kenneth Gibson: Not a Penny More—That the Parliament notes the cost of the Edinburgh trams project to be £545 million, of which £500 million is to be provided by the Scottish Government; considers that this sum is enough to complete the project, as previously agreed by the contractor; totally rejects any demands for additional funding, which would impact on projects elsewhere, and believes that not a single extra penny should be forthcoming. Supported by: Bill Kidd*, Christina McKelvie*, Shirley-Anne Somerville*
S3M-3494 Not a Penny More (lodged on 23 February 2009) Jamie Hepburn*, Brian Adam*, Stuart McMillan*, Gil Paterson*, Jim Tolson*
S3M-3494 Not a Penny More (lodged on 23 February 2009) Angela Constance*

S3M-3494 Kenneth Gibson: Not a Penny More—That the Parliament notes the cost of the Edinburgh trams project to be £545 million, of which £500 million is to be provided by the Scottish Government; considers that this sum is enough to complete the project, as previously agreed by the contractor; totally rejects any demands for additional funding, which would impact on projects elsewhere, and believes that not a single extra penny should be forthcoming. Supported by: Bill Kidd, Christina McKelvie, Shirley-Anne Somerville, Jamie Hepburn, Brian Adam, Stuart McMillan, Gil Paterson, Jim Tolson, Angela Constance, Sandra White*, Michael Matheson*
S3M-3494 Not a Penny More (lodged on 23 February 2009) Christine Grahame*
S3M-3494 Not a Penny More (lodged on 23 February 2009) Joe FitzPatrick*
